entry.title: Notenik 3.2.0 Released

summary.p: New Markdown parser added, with built-in wiki-style inter-note linking.

entry.content: See the Blog post on Notenik.net for a summary of recent changes to the Mac App.

entry.title: Notenik Now Up to 3.0.0

summary.p: My little Mac app is now up to version 3.0.0, is up to 10 ratings in the Mac app store, and still has an average rating of 4.9! I've received lots of feedback about the app over the last few months, and the latest release is better than ever!

entry.content: My little Mac app is now up to version 3.0.0, is up to 10 ratings in the Mac app store, and still has an average rating of 4.9! I've received lots of feedback about the app over the last few months, and the latest release is better than ever!

entry.title: Dethroning the False God of User Experience Design

summary.p: As users of computers, do we really want our experiences to be so carefully and intentionally and restrictively designed for us?

entry.content: As users of computers, do we really want our experiences to be so carefully and intentionally and restrictively designed for us?

entry.title: My Prayer for a More Integral New Year

summary.p: I want to take a moment to offer up a prayer – not to God, but to all of us – for a more integral sense of who we are in the new year.

entry.content: I want to take a moment to offer up a prayer – not to God, but to all of us – for a more integral sense of who we are in the new year.

entry.title: Blogging Further Down the list of the Rolling Stone Top 500 Albums

summary.p: Some of the albums in the latest batch flew like eagles, while others sank like stones. Check out our latest multi-generational assessments of the top 500 albums of all time.

entry.title: Notenik Forges Ahead

summary.p: Multiple recent releases, a rating of 4.9, users across the globe, and a mention from a Mac blogger. It's been a good couple of months for my Notenik app!

entry.content:
I've been releasing new and improved versions of Notenik fairly regularly over the last couple of months, and it's now up to 2.2.0 in the Mac App Store, with 2.3.0 on the way.

As I write this, my little app now has 7 ratings in the store, and an average rating of 4.9.

I've received emails about the app from a couple of people I've never met before — one user in Australia, and another in Finland! Nice to know that my software can be used around the globe.

Brett Terpstra was nice enough to mention my app in one of his recent blog posts, calling it "intriguing."

But there's still more to do, and continuing work on Notenik keeps me busy doing something I enjoy.

If you have a Mac, and haven't yet checked it out, then I encourage you to give it a whirl!

entry.title: The Personal vs. The Institutional
entry.content: Published on The Practical Utopian, and on Medium, and emailed to subscribers in The Practopian Perspective Issue 40.
